page.title: 13BIOGRAPHY..COMMITTEES
page.content: Adam Hunter, born in Sauchie, Alloa, Clackmanshire, came to Kelty early in 1914. Adam was educated at Kelty Primary School and left school when he was 14 years of age. He began work in the mining industry in December, 1922 and remained a miner until July 1963. Adam has been involved in public and organisational work all his life. These offices are to numerous to mention in detail. Adam was an active Trade Unionist. Adam left the mining industry in 1964 after 41 years in the industry. Adam became a Member of Parliament that year representing Dunfermline Burgh being sponsored by the N.U.M. Adam retired in 1979 after 14 years as an M.P. Adam still leads an active life and is involved in many local community committees e.g. the Kidney Research/Equipment Fund.
